intro: Duschekia kamtschatica, commonly known as the Kamchatka duschekia, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
